title: ISS crew reports “unexpected odor” from Russian Progress cargo spacecraft
summary:
Hatches between a Russian module and the rest of the International Space Station were closed hours after a Progress cargo spacecraft docking Nov. 23 when the station’s crew reported an “unexpected odor” from the spacecraft.
The post ISS crew reports “unexpected odor” from Russian Progress cargo spacecraft appeared first on SpaceNews.

title: Live coverage: SpaceX to launch Starlink satellites on Falcon 9 rocket from the Kennedy Space Center
summary: The mission would be SpaceX’s second of the day and likely the last before the Thanksgiving holiday on Thursday. Liftoff of the Starlink 6-76 mission from pad 39A at NASA’s Kennedy Space Center is set for no earlier than 10:35 p.m. EST (0335 UTC).

title: China launches pair of SuperView Neo-2 radar satellites
summary:

title: Rocket Lab launches two Electrons within 24 hours
summary:
Rocket Lab launched a pair of Electron rockets with 24 hours of each other Nov. 24, a first for the company.
The post Rocket Lab launches two Electrons within 24 hours appeared first on SpaceNews.

title: Toxic Smell from Progress MS-29 Triggers Decontamination Procedures
summary: Cosmonauts opening the new Progress MS-29 cargo ship that docked with the International Space Station yesterday observed a toxic smell and droplets. Decontamination procedures reportedly were implemented on both the […]

title: After Russian ship docks to space station, astronauts report a foul smell
summary: Cosmonauts aboard the Russian segment of the station donned protective equipment.

title: Better data, innovation and regulation needed to tackle growing space debris threat
summary:
HELSINKI — Managing the growing threat of space debris requires greater urgency, with improved sensor capability, filling data gaps, economic incentives and new technologies all needed, according to a panel […]

title: Live coverage: SpaceX to launch 23 Starlink satellites on Falcon 9 rocket from Cape Canaveral
summary: SpaceX’s senior director of satellite engineering said following regulatory approval, the DTC constellation will allow texting at the onset and data usage beginning in 2025. Liftoff of the Starlink 12-1 mission from pad 40 at Cape Canaveral Space Force Station is set for 4:35 a.m. EST (0935 UTC).

title: NASA to make lunar cargo delivery awards to Blue Origin and SpaceX
summary:
NASA plans to use cargo versions of Artemis lunar landers under development by Blue Origin and SpaceX to deliver a pressurized rover and surface habitat to the lunar surface in the early 2030s.
The post NASA to make lunar cargo delivery awards to Blue Origin and SpaceX appeared first on SpaceNews.
